form.official-title: To increase Social Security and military retirement benefits by 2.9 percent, and base future cost-of-living increase adjustments to the Consumer Price Index for the elderly.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Seniors Deserve A Raise Act.

section.header: Cost-of-living increases for Social Security and military retirement and survivor benefits to be based on Consumer Price Index for the elderly
section.text: Notwithstanding the adjustments otherwise required by sections 1401a, 1451(g)(1), 1451(h)(1), and 1452(a)(4)(B) of title 10, United States Code, and section 215(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 415(i)), whenever there is an increase in the Consumer Price Index for the elderly, published by the Department of Labor, that is greater than the previous increase in the Consumer Price Index, the dollar amounts in effect for the payment of the following benefits, as such amounts were in effect immediately before such increase, shall be increased by the same percentage as the Consumer Price Index for the elderly was increased above the prior Consumer Price Index increase:

paragraph.text: Any old-age, survivors, or disability insurance benefit under title II of the Social Security Act.
Any military retirement or survivor benefit program administered pursuant to title 10, United States Code.

section.header: Additional one-time cost-of-living increase to compensate for failure to base past increases on Consumer Price Index for the elderly
section.text: In addition to any increase required by section 2 for a year, each benefit described in such section shall be increased by 2.9 percent on January 1, 2016, and shall remain in effect every year thereafter.
